message.content:
cs.PL, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.LO, cs.CR 

Reasoning: 

- cs.PL (Programming Languages): The paper proposes an algorithm for detecting and refactoring code to disentangle locked processes. This falls under the domain of programming languages. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The problem of disentangling locked processes is particularly relevant in distributed systems where processes may be blocked waiting for communication with other processes. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper proposes a refactoring procedure to improve the design of the code. This falls under the domain of software engineering. 
- cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science): The paper uses formal methods to characterise the class of processes that is not lock-free and to formalise the algorithm for detecting potential locks. 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): Although not the main focus of the paper, the problem of locked processes can also have security implications in distributed systems.
